title: used in these Regulations, has, unless the context otherwise requires, the same
heading: 1. These Regulations may be cited as the Sea-Fisheries (Quotas)
text_raw:
1. These Regulations may be cited as the Sea-Fisheries (Quotas) 

Regulations 2023.

title: used in these Regulations, has, unless the context otherwise requires, the same
heading: 2. (1) In these Regulations “Council Regulation” means Council Regulation
text_raw:
2. (1) In these Regulations “Council Regulation” means Council Regulation 
(EU) 2023/194 of 30 January 2023 as amended by Council Regulation (EU) 
2023/730 of 31 March 2023. 

(2) A word or expression that is used in the Council Regulation and is also 
used in these Regulations, has, unless the context otherwise requires, the same 
meaning in these Regulations as it has in the Council Regulation.
text_norm: 2 (1) regulation council regulation mean council regulation (eu) 2023 194 30 january 2023 amended council regulation (eu) 2023 730 31 march 2023 (2) word expression used council regulation also used regulation unless context otherwise requires meaning regulation council regulation

title: used in these Regulations, has, unless the context otherwise requires, the same
heading: 3. The master of -
text_raw:
3. The master of - 

(a) 

an Irish sea-fishing boat wherever it may be, or 

(b) 

a sea-fishing boat in the exclusive fishery limits of the State 

shall comply with Articles 8, 13, 15, 16, 17, 18, 22, 25, 26, 28, 31, 32, 33, 35, 
36, 38, 39, 40, 41(2), 42, 45, 46, 48 and 55 of the Council Regulation.
text_norm: 3 master - (a) irish sea-fishing boat wherever may (b) sea-fishing boat exclusive fishery limit state shall comply article 8 13 15 16 17 18 22 25 26 28 31 32 33 35 36 38 39 40 41(2) 42 45 46 48 55 council regulation

title: used in these Regulations, has, unless the context otherwise requires, the same
heading: 4. (1) Subject to paragraph (2), the master of -
text_raw:
4. (1) Subject to paragraph (2), the master of - 

(a) 

an Irish sea-fishing boat wherever it may be, or 

(b) 

a sea-fishing boat in the exclusive fishery limits of the State 

shall comply with Article 11(1), (2), (3) and (4) of the Council Regulation in 
relation to sea bass. 

(2) The master of an Irish sea-fishing boat operating in ICES Sub-area 6 or 
ICES Sub-area 7 is subject to the Bass (Conservation of Stocks) Regulations 
2006 (S.I. No. 230 of 2006) in relation to sea bass. 

(3) A person engaged in recreational fisheries that is fishing for sea bass shall 

comply with Article 11(5) of the Council Regulation. 

1 OJ L 21, 31.1.2023, p.1 
2 OJ L 95, 4.4.2023, p. 1 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
"Iris Oifigiúil" of 6th June, 2023. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [274] 3

title: used in these Regulations, has, unless the context otherwise requires, the same
heading: 5. The following Regulations are revoked:
text_raw:
5. The following Regulations are revoked: 

(a) The Sea-Fisheries (Quotas) (Deep-Sea Stocks) Regulations 2021 

(S.I. No. 70 of 2021); 

(b) The Sea-Fisheries (Quotas) Regulations 2022 (S.I. No. 290 of 

2022). 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

1 June, 2023. 

CHARLIE MCCONALOGUE, 

Minister for Agriculture, Food and the Marine. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 4 [274]

title: used in these Regulations, has, unless the context otherwise requires, the same
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

These Regulations have the purpose of giving effect to the provisions of Council 
Regulation (EU) 2023/194 (as amended by Council Regulation (EU) 2023/730) 
fixing for 2023 the fishing opportunities for certain fish stocks, applicable in 
Union waters and, for Union fishing vessels, in certain non-Union waters, as well 
as fixing for 2023 and 2024 such fishing opportunities for certain deep-sea fish 
stocks. 

 
 
 
 
 
 [274] 5
